to join and fasten_off stitch glossary back loop front loop and third loop the standard crochet stitch has two loops in a v - the front loop which is closest to you - the back loop which is closer to the back of the work as it is currently held - the third loop occurs on the back of a half_double_crochet below the back loop bl indicates the stitch should only be worked in the back loop of the previous row fl indicates the stitch should only be worked in the front loop of the previous row tl indicates the stitch should be worked in the third loop of the previous row running double_crochet 3ch yarn-over hook insert hook in 3third chain from the hook yarn-over and pull through 1 three loops on hook yarn-over pull through 2 yarn-over pull though 2 1 loop on hook for the second and subsequent stitches yarn-over insert hook between previous st and stitch before yarn-over yarn-over and pull through
